plaintiff.name: Eman Youssef
plaintiff.consumer_status: Individual 'consumer' within the meaning of both the FCRA and applicable state FCRA

factual_background.summary: Plaintiff, a victim of identity theft while traveling abroad, disputed fraudulent charges with defendant TD Bank, who failed to reasonably investigate. The defendant credit reporting agencies subsequently failed to correct her credit reports, leading to significant financial and emotional damages.

events.description: Took them to Egypt with her
$7,500 in fraudulent charges in one week
Second time went into TD Bank, they told her to file a police report...
An employee of TD Bank told client that her son used the card
Details of multiple visits and calls to TD Bank

causes_of_action.title: FIRST CAUSE OF ACTION - VIOLATION OF THE FCRA

allegations.description: Failure to conduct reasonable reinvestigations of the Plaintiff’s multiple disputes.
Failure to review and consider all relevant information submitted by the Plaintiff.
Failure to delete or modify disputed erroneous information after failing to verify its accuracy.
Failure to conduct reasonable reinvestigations of Plaintiff’s multiple disputes after receiving notice from CRAs.

causes_of_action.title: SECOND CAUSE OF ACTION - VIOLATION OF THE NY FCRA

allegations.description: Reporting erroneous information when they knew, or should have known, it was inaccurate.
Failure to conduct reasonable reinvestigations of the Plaintiff’s multiple disputes.
Failure to delete or modify disputed information after failing to verify its completeness and accuracy.

damages.summary: The erroneous derogatory payment information wrongfully listed on Plaintiff's consumer reports caused damages including, but not limited to, damage to reputation, adverse impact on credit rating, being denied credit, in addition to emotional distress, expenditure of time and resources, annoyance, aggravation, and frustration.
